abstract: Istithmar World’s portfolio — one of Dubai’s once-heralded trophy assets — could be sold as part of a restructuring.
snippet: Istithmar World’s portfolio — one of Dubai’s once-heralded trophy assets — could be sold as part of a restructuring.
lead_paragraph: Dubai’s once-heralded trophy assets now look more like lead weights. Istithmar World, one of the investment vehicles controlled by the emirate, has a portfolio that was estimated to be worth $9 billion last year. It includes a stash of big Western names, including Cirque du Soleil, Standard Chartered, GLG Partners, Perella Weinberg and Barneys New York. Now they could all be sold as part of a restructuring.

byline.original: By Una Galani and Jeffrey Goldfarb

abstract: Bank of America may have a struggle on its hands as it tries to meld three banking cultures, after making a deal to buy Merrill Lynch and installing a Goldman Sachs executive into a top job, Breakingviews says.
snippet: Bank of America may have a struggle on its hands as it tries to meld three banking cultures, after making a deal to buy Merrill Lynch and installing a Goldman Sachs executive into a top job, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: It’s hard enough combining two banking cultures. Bank of America is, in effect, melding three — after making a deal to buy Merrill Lynch a year ago this week — and subsequently installing a Goldman Sachs executive into a top job. The banking giant may well succeed, but could wind up with the worst of each, Breakingviews.com says.

headline.main: At Bank of America, Clash or Cohesion?

abstract: A judge said a $33 million settlement over Merrill Lynch bonuses “does not comport with the most elementary notions of justice and morality.”
snippet: A judge said a $33 million settlement over Merrill Lynch bonuses “does not comport with the most elementary notions of justice and morality.”
lead_paragraph: As President Obama traveled to Wall Street on Monday and chided bankers for their recklessness, across town a federal judge issued a far sharper rebuke, not just for some of the financiers but for their regulators in Washington as well.

headline.main: Judge Rejects Settlement Over Merrill Bonuses
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects A Settlement Over Bonuses

abstract: A federal judge in New York has rejected a proposed $33 million settlement between Bank of America and the Securities and Exchange Commission over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives just before the bank took over Merrill last year.
snippet: A federal judge in New York has rejected a proposed $33 million settlement between Bank of America and the Securities and Exchange Commission over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives just before the bank took over Merrill last year.
lead_paragraph: A Federal District judge on Monday overturned a settlement between the Bank of America and the Securities and Exchange Commission over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives just before the bank took over Merrill last year.

headline.main: Judge Rejects Settlement Over Merrill Bonuses
